Posts.Content: Jan 9, 2009 03:24PM Luckysmom wrote: Don't read too much on the internet; it will indeed scare you to death. Wait for your results to come in. As you can see by surfing around this site, cancer is not fun but it is indeed manageable. One thing I learned from my experience of three years ago was that I had a slew of people wanting to help me if I would only open my mouth and ask for it .... these boards too were a huge source of strength and support for me during my journey. Be good to yourself, take plenty of deep cleansing breaths. Waiting is a bitch, no doubt about it. We've all been there and will be there for you!
Posts.Title: Can't stop reading "stats" on web. In bad shape... shabby6485 Member_of_the_Club

Posts.Content: Nov 20, 2011 11:48PM Luckysmom wrote: Wow does this list bring back memories. There wasn't anything like this when I went thru my chemo. What I tell people now is to stock up on popsickles; they were the only thing I could stomach during the later chemo treatments. I always take one with me for my girlfriend who I sit with during her chemo treatments. God bless all of you; I got so much wonderful support from this board every step of the way in 2006 and am so grateful for it. My Profile says I joined in 2007 for some reason; I joined a week after my March 2006 diagnosis. Hugs to all of you.
Posts.Title: More Tips (and a Shopping List) for Getting Through Chemo rock MinusTwo
